R. L. Adams Plastics, Inc. located at 5955 Crossroads Commerce Wyoming, MI is committed to a safe work place for our employees and committed to being good stewards of our environment and community.



R. L. Adams Plastics, Inc. is a producer of polystyrene foam using Difluoroethane and Isopentane to produce various products using tandem extrusion lines. The extruded product is in sheet form. This sheet is converted into various products.



This facility has strict no smoking and hot work policies in effect campus wide. No smoking signs are posted inside and outside the campus. Only trained and qualified personnel are allowed to off load Difluoroethane and Isopentane. The Difluoroethane and Isopentane tanks are located in an isolated area surrounded by concrete block wall with a locked fence gate to restrict access. The Isopentane tank has a dike for secondary containment.  The tanks have an earth ground to protect the tank and for the bonding of offloading trucks. Both tanks have a bulk load delivery system to insure safety of the unloading process and eliminate the risk of spills from delivery hoses.   Both tanks are inspected at the end of each shift. All employees are trained annually in the safe handling and flammability of the product. New employee orientation procedure includes safeguards to Difluoroethane and Isopentane. The building has LEL monitors at 12 points throughout the building, with alarms and automatic phone call list at specific LEL alarm points.  



The overall safety program at R.L. Adams Plastics Inc. begins with management commitment to the overall safe practices and policies to protect our employees and community. This facility has specific safety procedures and policies that directly relate to Difluoroethane and Isopentane are strictly enforced. Starting with training of new employees at orientation to annual training of all employees and updates as needed for Difluoroethane and Isopentane safety and right to know. There are strict zero to

lerance no smoking and open flame policies in effect. The transportation and delivery of Difluoroethane and Isopentane are performed by trained and qualified personnel.  The permanently mounted gas leak detection systems with continuous monitoring, and test procedures that are done at each shift of operation are in place to forewarn of possible leak potentials. Control measures are in place starting with the storage of Difluoroethane and Isopentane and continue through to the end process.



PROCESS

Difluoroethane and Isopentane are delivered to R. L. Adams Plastics via tanker trucks. The driver is required to read and understand R.L. Adams Plastics Gas Receiving Policy which includes safety procedures and information for delivery. The Difluoroethane and Isopentane are unloaded using a truck mounted pump to the above ground tank with maximum quantity of 45,000 lbs. and 56,000 lbs. (respectively) in a secured tank farm using a vapor recovery system that prevents the release of vapors. The truck is bonded to the earth ground to prevent sparks. The driver must be qualified and trained in the safe handling of this product. The driver must be with the truck continuously throughout the unloading procedure. 



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

This facility has not had a recordable accident in the past five years.
